module.title: Module 1: How AI Thinks
module.description: Explore the fundamentals of how AI processes information and makes decisions

lessons.title: Lesson 1.1: Understanding Tokens
lessons.objective: Learn how AI breaks down and processes text into tokens

sections.title: What Are Tokens?
sections.content: When you type a sentence, AI doesn't see words the way you do. Instead, it breaks text into smaller pieces called 'tokens'. Think of tokens as the building blocks of language that AI can understand and process.

sections.title: Why Tokens Matter
sections.content:
Understanding tokenization helps you:
• Write more effective prompts for AI
• Understand AI limitations (token limits)
• Predict how AI will interpret your text
• Optimize your AI interactions

interactiveElements.title: Visual Tokens: See How AI Reads Text
interactiveElements.description: Type a sentence to see how AI breaks it into tokens

questions.question: What is a token in AI?
options: A small piece of text that AI processes
questions.explanation: Tokens are the building blocks of text that AI uses to understand and process language.

lessons.title: Lesson 1.2: Predictive Text and AI
lessons.objective: Understand how AI predicts and generates text

sections.title: How AI Predicts
sections.content: AI language models work by predicting the most likely next word based on patterns learned from massive amounts of text. It's like an incredibly sophisticated autocomplete system.

sections.title: The Prediction Process
sections.content:
1. AI analyzes the current context (previous words)
2. Calculates probability for thousands of possible next words
3. Selects the most likely option (or samples from top options)
4. Repeats the process for each new word

interactiveElements.title: Sentence Builder: AI Predictions
interactiveElements.description: Click words to build a sentence and see how AI predicts the next word

questions.question: How does AI generate text?
options: By predicting the most likely next word
questions.explanation: AI generates text by predicting the most likely next word based on patterns learned from training data.

lessons.title: Lesson 1.3: AI Personalities
lessons.objective: Explore how AI behavior can be customized through personality traits

sections.title: Customizing AI Behavior
sections.content: AI assistants can be programmed with different 'personalities' by adjusting how they respond. This is done through system prompts that guide the AI's tone, style, and approach.

sections.title: Common Personality Traits
sections.content:
• Formal: Professional and structured responses
• Creative: Imaginative and innovative thinking
• Socratic: Asks guiding questions instead of giving direct answers
• Encouraging: Supportive and positive feedback
• Concise: Brief and to-the-point
• Detailed: Thorough explanations

sections.title: Why Personality Matters
sections.content: Different learning situations call for different AI personalities. A student struggling with confidence might benefit from an encouraging AI, while someone seeking deep understanding might prefer a Socratic approach.

interactiveElements.title: Build-a-Bot: Create Your AI Assistant
interactiveElements.description: Select personality traits and chat with your custom AI

questions.question: What determines an AI's personality?
options: System prompts that guide its behavior
questions.explanation: AI personality is shaped by system prompts that define how it should respond and interact.

questions.question: Which personality trait would be best for a student who needs to develop critical thinking?
questions.explanation: A Socratic approach asks guiding questions that help students think critically and discover answers themselves.
